This is just an observation as I'm not sure which direction Microsoft will take with Linux distro to do the auto upgrade of PowerShell Core.

Steps to reproduce
------------------
sudo apt update

sudo apt upgrade

```powershell
pwsh
$psversiontable
```

Expected behavior
-----------------
After executing apt upgrade then PowerShell Core 6.0.0 would have been installed.
```none

```

Actual behavior
---------------
It just won't download PowerShell Core 6.0.0 for upgrade
```none

```

Workaround
--------------
Manually do the following steps:
sudo apt remove powershell
sudo apt install -y powershell

Environment data
----------------
Window 10 Ubuntu
Ubuntu 16.04
Ubuntu 17.10

<!-- provide the output of $PSVersionTable -->

```powershell
> $PSVersionTable

```
![pscore6 0 0_03c_2018-01-10_17-37-05](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/19892435/34800782-54a970ba-f633-11e7-8398-6b9200553da0.png)

sudo apt-get install --upgrade powershell

Perhaps this is related to the same thing seen in Suse? #5846

comments.author: rkeithhill
comments.body:
Yup, see the same thing here.  Those instructions should include running `sudo apt-get update` before installing the GA version e.g.:
```bash
sudo apt remove powershell
sudo apt-get update
sudo apt install -y powershell
```

comments.author: rkeithhill
comments.body: BTW after I did the `sudo apt-get update` I was able to use just `sudo apt-get install -y powershell` and it pulled down the GA version.

comments.author: SteveL-MSFT
comments.body: This is caused by https://github.com/PowerShell/PowerShell/issues/5846, we are working with the owners of packages.microsoft.com to update their cache after we removed the pre-release versions since alphabetically 6.0.0-1 comes before 6.0.0-alpha, 6.0.0-beta, and 6.0.0-rc

title: PSCore6 - Won't install in Ubuntu thru the apt Update/Upgrade
